definition: "ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
to learn on the job/to be on probation

sentences.english: She noted only slight difficulty in concentrating while reading and writing.
sentences.chinese: 她发觉在读习和写作时，注意力有点不易集中。

sentences.english: To attain proficiency in the dual aspects of mental and physical discipline takes a high degree of devotion and dedication.
sentences.chinese: 为取得身心两方面的功夫，习武者须投入大量精力。

sentences.english: Learn to esteem other people's personal space.
sentences.chinese: 壆习尊重他人的私人空间。

sentences.english: The questions and format will be similar to previous years (although the exercises from some past years were 5 hours long, not three).
sentences.chinese: 即使过去部分习作为五小时而非三小时。

sentences.english: So for the sake of our health and our study, we must have breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 所以，为了我们的健康和学，习，我们必须吃早餐。

sentences.english: The child brings TREMENDOUS INGENUITY to the task of learning.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在壆习语言时，发挥了极大的灵活性。

sentences.english: Mr Xi's speech was peppered with references to values, but did not come close to suggesting that any were universal.
sentences.chinese: 习的讲话频繁提及价值观念，却无一暗示出世界性。

sentences.english: The law never suffers anything contrary to trun.
sentences.chinese: 法律习决不容忍违反真理的事情。

sentences.english: Mary gave some counsel on how to learn English.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽提了一些如何壆习英语的建议。

sentences.english: Xi père later served as governor of Guangdong province and as vice-premier of China.
sentences.chinese: 习父亲后来成为广东省省长和中国副总理。

sentences.english: For convenience of intensive study, he has an intense purpose of making friend with me.
sentences.chinese: 为便于强化壆习，他有和我交朋友的强烈意向。

sentences.english: When it comes to education, a heap of people believe that education is a lifetime study.
sentences.chinese: 说到教育，大部分人认为其是一个终生的壆习。

sentences.english: Practise martial arts person has to need to have skill , then it is possible let self move style have antipersonnel force.
sentences.chinese: 习武者必须要具备功力才能使自己的招式有杀伤力。

sentences.english: For advantage of intensive learn, he has an intense intention of making friend with me.
sentences.chinese: 为便于强化壆习，他有和我交朋友的强烈意向。

definition: to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
